Hangu district is new district of N W F P  province of Pakistan about 30 kilometres from Kohat and 60 kilometres  from Peshawar. It is mainly inhabited by Bangash and Orakzai tribes. It is a very beautiful place with lush green valleys surrounded by beautiful mountains. Unfortunately, there have been riots between the Sunni and Shia Muslims recently, and at night, you fall asleep not to the sounds of crickets, but sometimes to the sounds of gunfire and explosions.
Buses connect with Peshawar, islamabad, Karachi, Rawa Pinti and Korhat.
The 'sun gate' mall sells jewellery and other supplies. Also has a beauty parlour.
Like much of Pakistan do not rely on English to communicate.
